summary: The diff implements the core client-side SPA for upload/preview, resize (contain/cover + aspect lock), enhancement sliders (brightness/contrast/saturation/sharpen/smoothing) with apply+reset, and export (PNG/JPEG + JPEG quality). However, the required generated brand assets are only referenced, not shown as added under the required public path, and unrequested authentication/Internet Identity hooks were added (conflicting with the non-goal of user accounts/auth).

missing_requirements.requirement: Use generated static brand assets in the UI (logo and a subtle background texture) by placing them in frontend/public/assets/generated and referencing them directly from the frontend.
missing_requirements.reason: The UI references the asset URLs, but the diff summary does not show the required generated image files being added under frontend/public/assets/generated (and two added files were omitted due to limits, so existence cannot be confirmed from provided evidence).
evidence: File diff summary notes: "Omitted files due to limits: added=2" (assets not shown)

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity / authentication context and actor creation hooks (login/logout, identity handling, authenticated vs anonymous actor).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest non-goals explicitly exclude user accounts/authentication; these hooks introduce authentication-related functionality not requested for the photo tool.
BuildRequest non-goals specify no server-side image processing and no backend storage; adding a backend module is not requested (even if currently empty).
